comment: She responds to emails; however, you might have to wait a while before you get a grade for the discussions and tests. Make sure to turn in assignments on time.

Not the worst professor you could have. I did homework for other classes during this class and just read the chapters and took notes on them afterwards. Tests are exactly from the book. Some in class participation, but as long as you keep up with the material and online homework you really dont have to show up.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She is an amazing professor. So many people are judgemental and give her a bad review because she has a speech impediment, but she is, in fact, one of the best professors that I have had here at KSU. If you don't understand something she is more than willing to sit down with you one on one and explain. She is sweet and really cares about her students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Don't bother buying the textbook, most of the course material is basic knowledge you learned in high school. To get an A, just do all the online MES and study for the tests and you should be fine. She also made us do a lot of unnecessary evaluations. It's true that her lectures are boring, but you need to take notes to know what's on the tests.

She cares a lot about her students success. She is not a bad person nor a bad teacher, but an AWFUL public speaker. You will get close to nothing from her lectures and I never paid attention. She offered a bit of extra credit, just go to class, not a very challenging A.

Civil engineer teaching environmental science? BAD. She talks about all of the subjects in the book, but is one of the worst public speakers I have ever encountered. Copies powerpoints straight from the book and has no outside knowledge of the information. I read during class and just took notes on the book at home.
Powerpoints WAYYYYY tooo long, none of it is her information so she just reads and makes comments, very boring. You dont need the textbook, but you need to shell out money for the code.

Class is very lecture heavy with pretty long power point slides. Yet, she's very informative and gave extra credit to help. Textbook isn't really need, though you can use it to fill in the power point slides if you miss class and it helps out tremendously when doing online assignments. Solid choice for a professor, just be prepared to do your part.

It was her first semester teaching, so things didn't go as smooth as it would with an experienced teacher. There are only four exams all semester with the homework being your only buffer grade, but the exams are very easy. BTW Don't buy the textbook, buy the Mastering Environmental Science code.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY
